channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report X-2023070918
item.description:
Report X-2023070918

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: ROANOKE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was located on the van lines after being removed from unload trailer. Package was found by QA and removed from van line to inspect items. DescribePack: Liquid fell leaked out of a gallon of oven & grill cleaner due to loose cap. The amount of liquid was estimated to be a cup size spill through the loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Gallons jugs of oven & grill cleaner were removed from boxes and placed in hazmat bins to prevent liquids from spilling further on ground.

item.title: Report X-2023060860
item.description:
Report X-2023060860

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A leaking fiberboard box was found will unloading a ULD at the RIC facility. The fiberboard box contained four glass bottles and on of them was broken. The bottles were packaged with egg crates top and bottom. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for an amended declaration for movement.
